alert.note: Alert for La Crosse (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 11:33PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Wisconsin, including the following county, La Crosse. * WHEN...Until 245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1132 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, with rain fall rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Crosse, Onalaska, French Island, La Crosse Airport, Brice Prairie, North Side Of La Crosse and Highway 33 And Losey Boulevard. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
